description: Master collection of all backend algorithms powering chunking, schema validation, snippet extraction, recommendations, and citation prediction.

algorithms.name: Content Chunking & Indexing
algorithms.goal: Divide raw content into smaller meaningful chunks (Q&A style, headers, lists) for AI engines to cite easily.
steps: Input: Raw HTML/Page Content
Clean content (remove ads, boilerplate, duplicate text)
Chunk by headers (H1, H2, H3), paragraphs, FAQs
Ensure each chunk is self-contained (40–80 words)
Store chunks with metadata (title, question, answer, date)

chunks.question: What is AEO?
chunks.answer: Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) is optimizing content for AI citation...

algorithms.name: Schema Validation Engine
algorithms.goal: Check schema markup (FAQ, HowTo, Product, LocalBusiness) for completeness & compliance with 2025 standards.
steps: Parse structured data (JSON-LD, Microdata)
Validate required fields (context, type, mainEntity)
Check freshness of schema (lastUpdated within 90 days)
Score schema completeness (0–1 scale)

algorithms.name: Snippet Extraction Engine
algorithms.goal: Extract 40–60 word concise answers from content to maximize AI snippet citation.
steps: Scan chunks for direct answer sentences
Trim paragraphs into 40–60 word summaries
Add metadata (question, context, updated date)
Rank snippets by clarity and authority

output_example.snippet: AEO (Answer Engine Optimization) ensures your content is cited by AI...

algorithms.name: Optimization Recommendation Engine
algorithms.goal: Generate actionable optimization steps (content, schema, authority, freshness) to improve AI visibility.
steps: Input: Page data (chunks, schema, snippets, last_updated)
Check missing schema → Recommend fixes
Check old updates → Recommend refresh
Check missing Q&A format → Recommend rewriting
Output prioritized recommendations with estimated impact

recommendations.message: Add missing author field in FAQ schema

algorithms.name: Citation Prediction Engine
algorithms.goal: Predict likelihood of a page being cited in ChatGPT, Gemini, or Perplexity.
steps: Input: Page data (schema, snippets, freshness, authority, structure)
Weight each factor (schema=25%, snippets=20%, authority=20%, freshness=15%, structure=20%)
Calculate normalized citation score (0–1)
Adjust score for platform preferences (ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity)
